Pre-Game Insights: Wales will be intent on claiming maximum points as they continue their UEFA Nations League campaign against Montenegro on Monday.
Wales have won two and lost two of their previous meetings with Montenegro, with the sole win coming in Podgorica five weeks ago when they went two goals up within two minutes and 27 seconds.
Montenegro have now suffered five consecutive defeats, their worst run since becoming an independent football nation back some 17 years ago.
Wales have shown signs of promise under new management, with a goalless draw against Turkey followed by a 2-1 victory in Montenegro.
Montenegro are expected to retain their front line of captain Stevan Jovetic and Lecce striker Nikola Krstovic, despite scoring just one goal in three group games so far.
Post-Match Reflections: Wales should have sufficient firepower to see off a Montenegro side that has struggled to score goals this year.
The hosts were impressive in their last run-out at Cardiff City Stadium, falling just short of beating Group 4 leaders Turkey, so they are more than a match for ailing opponents.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wales' Brennan Johnson and Jordan James will both be ruled out by suspension, joining Ethan Ampadu, Dan James and captain Aaron Ramsey on the sidelines.
Montenegro are expected to retain their front line of captain Stevan Jovetic and Lecce striker Nikola Krstovic.
Wales possible starting lineup: Ward; Roberts, Rodon, Davies, Williams; Sheehan, Cooper; Burns, Wilson, Thomas; Moore
Montenegro possible starting lineup: Mijatovic; Marusic, Vujacic, Sipcic, Radunovic; Bakic, Vukotic, Jankovic; Krstovic, Camaj; Jovetic
